text: Rakhine State Hluttaw () is the legislature of the Rakhine State, Myanmar. It is a unicameral body, consisting of 47 members, including 35 elected members and 12 military representatives. As of February 2016, the Hluttaw was led by speaker San Kyaw Hla of the Arakan National Party (ANP). {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:right ! colspan="3" |Seats of Rakhine State Hluttaw by Parties (November 2010) |- !Party !Seats !Seats % |- |align=left|RNDP |18 |38.30 |- |align=left|USDP |14 |29.79 |- |align=left|NDPD |2 |4.26 |- |align=left|NUP |1 |2.12 |- |align=left|Military appointees |12 |25.53 |- |align=left|Total |47 |100 |} In 2015 general election, the Arakan National Party (ANP) won the most contested seats in the legislature. Myanmar Times - Election Winners Myanmar Times - State/Region Hluttaw Results: Graphics However, the ANP does not hold a majority of seats in the legislature due to the 12 appointed seats for military personnels. ==Hluttaw Seat after General Election (Nov. 2015)== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Party !Seats !+/– !Seats % |- |align=left|Arakan National Party (ANP)||22||4||46.81% |- |align=left|National League for Democracy (NLD)||9||9||19.15% |- |align=left|Union Solidarity and Development Party (USDP)||3||13||6.38% |- |align=left|Independent||1||1||2.13% |- |align=left|National Unity Party (NUP)||0||1 |- |align=left|Military Appointees||12|| ||25.53% |- |align=left|Total||47|| ||100% |} ==See also== *State and Region Hluttaws *Pyidaungsu Hluttaw *Rakhine State Government ==References== Category:Unicameral legislatures Category:Rakhine State Category:Legislatures of Burmese states and regions
title: Rakhine State Hluttaw
